title: Emilia Clarke admits she 'started crying' when she met Beyoncé and Jay Z
text:
Emilia Clarke says she 'was too many drinks in and started crying' when she met Beyoncé at the singer's Oscars afterparty.

The Game Of Thrones star, 33, said the pop icon, 38, 'got out of there very quickly' when she burst into tears at her bash because she was overwhelmed.

Speaking to Graham Norton, in scenes that will be aired on Friday, Emilia laughed about the moment she says she unexpectedly bumped into Jay-Z and Beyoncé.

Emotional: Emilia Clarke, 33, told Graham Norton that Beyoncé, 38, 'got out of there very quickly' when she burst into tears her Oscars after party earlier this year after getting drunk

Icon: Emilia laughed about the moment she says she unexpectedly bumped into Jay-Z and Beyoncé (pictured in July)

'I did not expect to see them in the flesh. I wasn't expecting that at all, I was just amazed to be invited,' she said.

'I was like, "How did that happen?" When I met Queen Bey I was too many drinks in and started crying. It didn't go well. I think she got out of there very quickly!'

She went on to talk about her friends' lack of interest in her Game Of Thrones success - after she rose to fame through eight seasons as Daenerys Targaryen.

Unsupportive: She went on to talk about her friends' lack of interest in her Game Of Thrones success - after she rose to fame through eight seasons as Daenerys Targaryen

Hungover: Talking about her new film, Last Christmas, Emilia described being 'in a perpetual sort of hangover state' during 'bonkers' filming in central London from 12pm until midday

Unwell: Emilia suffered from two brain aneurysms during filming for Game Of Thrones - with the first hitting while she was working out with her personal trainer aged 24

Latest role: Speaking to Stella magazine recently, the brunette beauty said she resonated with her character Kate in her new film Last Christmas, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness (pictured with Regina King)

'It started with things like, "We can't afford to stream Game of Thrones, we don't have the money, sorry Emilia," then it was, "We'll try and download it," then it was season eight and I was having a screening of the last episode and they said, "So we've seven and three quarter seasons to catch up before this Sunday!"

Talking about her new film, Last Christmas, Emilia described being 'in a perpetual sort of hangover state' during 'bonkers' filming in central London from 12pm until midday.

'Filming at Christmas in London last year was bonkers. Because we were in Covent Garden and Regent Street, we started at midnight and finished at midday and I was in a perpetual sort of hangover state.

Afterparty: Emilia is pictured at the Vanity Fair Oscars Party in LA on February 24, 2019, just hours before she says she 'was too many drinks in and started crying' when she met Beyoncé

Guests: Also speaking to Graham Norton was Aquaman star Jason Momoa (centre left), Oscar-winner Regina King (left), comic Ross Noble (right) and singer songwriter Camila Cabello

'Starting filming at midnight in the centre of London had its issues – there are a lot of drunk people wandering around and shouting at us and leaning out of windows telling us how bad we were!'

Speaking to Stella magazine recently, the brunette beauty said she resonated with her character Kate in her new film Last Christmas, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness.

Emilia suffered from two brain aneurysms during filming for Game Of Thrones - with the first hitting while she was working out with her personal trainer aged 24.

Former co-stars: Jason Momoa, 40, rose to prominence when he appeared on Game Of Thrones' first season in 2011, and went on to land the role of the King of Atlantis in Aquaman

'It was uncanny reading the script because it’s my life at this point,' she said.

'I have the benefit of having space between myself and my sickness and what you see through Kate is the fear of what happens when your body fails you in some way.'

In the film, Emilia's character Kate finds work as Santa's elf for a department store and unexpectedly finds love with Tom, played by Henry Golding.

Laughs: Jason had to have 'extensive blind training' to prepare for his role in his Apple TV+ series See, which he described as 'honest and really beautiful'

Also speaking to Graham Norton was Aquaman star Jason Momoa, Oscar-winner Regina King, comic Ross Noble and singer songwriter Camila Cabello.

Regina, 48, revealed she sometimes wishes a double would 'come in to do some of the sex scenes' for her character in her new TV series Watchmen.

When asked about her action stunts, she said: 'I’m a complete bad-ass. I’ll do some of them, but I have a stunt double to do all the hard stuff because I am not landing on the ground.

Fame: Asked about the success of Aquaman and the possibility of a sequel, he says, 'We will be back – probably in a year from now

'I don’t have to do that. I’m 48 and I don’t have anything to prove. I do sometimes wish that the double could come in to do some of the sex scenes – that would be awesome.'

The actress won an Oscar for supporting actress in her role as family matriarch in If Beale Street Could Talk earlier this year.

She told Graham Norton: 'They gave me a little talk about what to do, but all of it is such a blur in so many ways.

Hilarious: Emilia and Regina laugh as Jason talks to Graham Norton. 'When we took off the eye masks everything seemed diluted,' he said

'It still feels surreal, but I felt so much love in that room. Once you’ve won the pressure is off, and they do have a bar.'

Ross, talking about his nomination for an Olivier Award for his performance in Young Frankenstein at the West End, said: 'It was cool, but on the night, I couldn’t go because I was back on tour.

'If you can’t attend they show a picture of the nominee and I wanted them to use a photo of me on the sofa in my pants eating a packet of crisps. But apparently, it’s not the "done thing".'

All smiles: Regina (left), 48, revealed she sometimes wishes a double would 'come in to do some of the sex scenes' for her character in her new TV series Watchmen

Jason Momoa, 40, had to have 'extensive blind training' to prepare for his role in his Apple TV+ series See, which he described as 'honest and really beautiful'.

'When we took off the eye masks everything seemed diluted,' he said.

'Apple invested big on this one and it shows. We went to the most far out places in British Columbia because they didn’t want to shoot anywhere that has been shot before and they went to huge lengths to make it.'

Songstress: Camila (right) will perform Liar in the studio, before joining Graham for a chat about her new album

Jason rose to prominence when he appeared on Game Of Thrones' first season in 2011, and went on to land the role of the King of Atlantis in Aquaman.

Asked about the success of Aquaman and the possibility of a sequel, he says, 'We will be back – probably in a year from now.

'I was very excited about the reaction. We have a script, which we’ve pitched and I’ m very passionate about it.'

Camila will perform Liar in the studio, before joining Graham for a chat about her new album.

Greeting Emelia with, 'My queen' and giving her a tiny dragon, Camila reveals, 'I am the biggest Game of Thrones fan in the entire world. I am just freaking out to meet you guys. I literally went through all eight seasons in a month this year.'

The Graham Norton Show will play on BBC One on Friday, October 15 at 10.35pm.
description: Emilia Clarke says she 'was too many drinks in and started crying' when she met Beyoncé at the Oscars.
